timings: As a town, always accessible; individual attractions (Viceregal Lodge, Jakhoo Temple, etc.) have opening & closing times; many shops open ~08:00–20:00 or similar. Not documented precise uniform hours for all sites.
entry_fee: Varies by attraction (for example, Viceregal Lodge has an entry fee; museums etc.). Not documented in aggregate.
best_time: March to June (pleasant weather, clear skies), also September–November (post monsoon, avoid heavy rains) to avoid harsh winter (snow) depending on tolerance.
nearest_railway: Kalka Railway Station (broad gauge) – approx 96 km to Shimla by road + toy train from Kalka to Shimla; also Shimla has its own narrow-gauge Toy Train station.
nearest_bus: Shimla Bus Stand (old bus stand or New Bus Stand / ISBT Shimla) — in Shimla town center — approx within city (< 1–3 km depending on your location).
nearest_airport: Jubbarhatti Airport (Shimla Airport) — approx 23 km from Shimla city centre.
accessibility: Road to Shimla from lower areas is well-developed though winding; within Shimla some steep roads & many stairs in old parts; partial wheelchair access in newer/hotel areas; toy train is narrow gauge & slow, not accessible; snow / ice in winter can make certain roads difficult.
guided_tours: Local guides available; Himachal Tourism offers guided walks, heritage walks; audio tours/museum guides for specific attractions.
parking: Several parking lots around Shimla (at outskirts / near Mall Road etc.); charges vary (₹ around few hundreds per day, more in peak season) — Not documented exact charge.
nearby_amenities: Wide range — hotels, guest houses, cafés, restaurants, shops, markets, ATMs, hospitals etc.
special_notes: Shimla was summer capital during British Raj; has colonial architecture (Viceregal Lodge, Christ Church); toy train from Kalka is UNESCO heritage; snow in winter; festivals (Summer Festival, Ice Skating Carnival etc.).

timings: Town & outdoor attractions accessible; roads & passes (like Rohtang) open seasonally; many shops open ~ morning to evening. Not documented uniform opening-closing.
entry_fee: For certain passes/tunnels/parks etc. Rohtang Pass often has permit / entry / toll; adventure activity fees vary; local sightseeing mostly free or small charges. Not documented full list.
best_time: May to early October (for passes open, fewer snow closures); winters good for snow lovers but some roads closed.
nearest_railway: Joginder Nagar (narrow gauge from Pathankot–Joginder Nagar line) approx 150–200 km depending on route; also nearest broad gauge is Chandigarh / Pathankot etc. Not documented exact best station + distance.
nearest_bus: Manali Bus Stand — within Manali town.
nearest_airport: Bhuntar Airport (Kullu–Manali Airport) — approx 50 km from Manali town.
accessibility: Access by road — some rough stretches; interior places require walking or trekking; winter snow can block access; not fully wheelchair friendly especially outside town.
guided_tours: Adventure operators for treks, rafting, paragliding, local guides speak Hindi/English; many tour packages.
parking: Available in Manali town; limited near popular attractions; charges vary.
nearby_amenities: Many hotels/resorts, restaurants/cafés, shops, medical centres.
special_notes: Solang Valley, Rohtang Pass near by; river rafting in Beas; snow sports; cultural mix (Himachali, Tibetan etc.); peak tourist load in summer; environmental concerns near passes.

place_name: Dharamshala / McLeod Ganj, Kangra District (Himachal Pradesh)
category: Hill Station / Religious / Cultural (Tibetan Buddhist Centre)
timings: Open access to town; monasteries have prayer times; museums etc have scheduled hours. Not documented full uniform opening/closing of attractions.
entry_fee: For monasteries generally free; museums (like Tibetan Museum) have small fees; outdoor nature/free areas free. Not documented exact.
best_time: October–March for snow and winter atmosphere; also April–June for pleasant weather and greenery.
nearest_railway: Pathankot Railway Station (broad gauge) approx 85 km or more; Kangra / Kangra Valley Railway (narrow gauge) smaller lines.
nearest_bus: Dharamshala Bus Stand in Dharamshala town; McLeod Ganj also has local bus stops.
nearest_airport: Kangra Airport (Gaggal Airport) — approx 13–20 km from Dharamshala / McLeod Ganj.
accessibility: Road access is good (though winding); some steep paths in McLeod Ganj; snow in winter can make roads tricky; room for improvement for wheelchair accessibility.
guided_tours: Available (local Tibetan guides, trekking guides, etc.), language support in Hindi/English; spiritual retreats present.
parking: Available in Dharamshala town; limited in McLeod Ganj; during peak season crowded.
nearby_amenities: Hotels, guest houses (from basic to luxury), cafés, Tibetan-style eateries, shops for crafts, restrooms etc.
special_notes: Seat of Dalai Lama & the Tibetan government in exile; strong Tibetan culture; events like Losar; monasteries and meditation; scenery of Dhauladhar range.

timings: Town accessible always; many viewpoints / attractions have daylight hours. Not documented uniform closing times.
entry_fee: For some attractions (mini-treks, forest parks) small fees; otherwise free. Not documented exact amounts.
best_time: April to June & Sept to mid-October. Winters cold with snow; monsoon might bring landslides.

nearest_airport: Gaggal Airport (Kangra) or Pathankot Airport depending on service (Gaggal ~140-160 km perhaps; Pathankot closer for domestic flights) — Not documented precise nearest.

guided_tours: Local guide services, trekking, birding etc.
parking: Available in town; small parking fees likely at certain spots.
nearby_amenities: Hotels, colonial heritage bungalows, cafés, shops, restrooms, markets.
special_notes: Quiet, less crowded; colonial churches; views; good for short getaways from Delhi/Chandigarh.

place_name: Spiti Valley (incl. Kaza, monasteries), Lahaul & Spiti District (Himachal Pradesh)
category: Valley / High-Altitude Nature / Monasteries / Trekking / Eco-Tourism
timings: Many roads / high passes open only in summer (usually May to October)—winter much blocked by snow. Attractions (monasteries etc.) open in daylight.
entry_fee: Small fees in some monasteries, permits needed (inner line permit for foreigners in some remote regions); eco sites may have fees. Not documented exact.
best_time: Late May to September (when roads are open, weather moderate).
nearest_railway: Broad gauge stations are far (e.g. Chandigarh / Pathankot / Ambala) plus long road journeys; narrow gauge options limited; nearest realistic is Shimla-Kalka route or broad gauge up to nearest hub then road. Not documented precise nearest RG station to Kaza etc.
nearest_bus: Kaza Bus Stand; intermediate stops in Spiti (e.g. Nako, Tabo etc.).
nearest_airport: Bhuntar Airport or Kullu–Manali Airport are ones used for getting close, then long road journey from there. Not documented exact distances for all segments.
accessibility: High altitude, remote roads; rough mountain roads; altitude sickness risk; many treks; not wheelchair-friendly outside basic towns.
guided_tours: Many adventure / trekking agencies provide guided treks and monastery tours; local guides in villages.
parking: Basic parking in towns; near monasteries limited; remote spots may have none.
nearby_amenities: Accommodation more basic; guest houses, tea houses; fewer luxury options; supply shops limited; medical facilities in larger towns.
official_website: Himachal Tourism site has pages for Spiti Valley/Sites.
special_notes: Stunning landscapes, Tibetan Buddhist culture, ancient monasteries, cold desert terrain; high altitude trekking; passes like Kunzum; festivals like Losar etc.

timings: Town open always; attractions like Christ Church etc during daylight. Not documented specific opening hours.

nearby_amenities: Hotels, cafés, restaurants, shops, restrooms etc.
special_notes: Quiet, less crowded; colonial churches; views; good for short getaways from Delhi/Chandigarh.

best_time: April to June & September to October (good weather, clearer skies). Avoid heavy monsoon & harsh winters.
nearest_railway: Nearest broad gauge: Pathankot or other; nearest smaller stations: Ahju/Chamba branch — Not documented exact.
nearest_bus: Bir / Billing Bus Terminus in local area.
nearest_airport: Kangra Airport (Gaggal) probably nearest; also Bhuntar etc depending on route. Not documented exact.

guided_tours: Local guides, day-tour operators from Shimla.
